analyzeResult.content:
MEMORANDUM The American Tobacco Company
Mr. R. K. Heimann President
DATE
November 14, 1969
R. M. Irby, Jr., Manager - New Products Division Rassarch and Development
BUBJECT
Weekly Progress Report
Production scheduled in the factories for the week beginning November 17 includes 15 million SILVA THINS Menthol "S" and 10 million SILVA THINS Menthol "E" Cigarettes.
MARYLAND (Top Priority)
We have prepared a blend which we believe will be more in line with our require- mente with regards to taste and palstability of the smoke. Cigarettes will be fabricated on Tuesday, November 18, for full evaluation. We have contacted the Leaf Department concerning the availability of light (mountain type) Burley tobacco which we feel would be desirable for use in this cigarette. We are experimenting with TAREYTON type filters as well as all cellulose acetate filters in an attempt to assure that the taste of the cigarette is smooth and satisfying.
RC CIGARETTES
We are currently evaluating cigarettes made from various RC sheets prepared from types of tobacco in order to establish firm guidelines for the most satisfactory formula for the blended sheet. Our current feelings are that more leafy grades of tobaccos might be necessary since some of the desirable characteristics may be lost in the fabrication process.
RC-FS
Our Initial, samples of SILVA THINS were not satisfactory with regard to the required percentages of RC-FS and Durham is remaking these samples. As soon as we complete our evaluation, we will forward them to New York for your consideration. LUCKY STRIKE and PALL MALL Cigarettes containing the new RC formula will be fabricated at Virginia Branch during the latter part of next week.
SILVA THINS MODIFICATION
We acknowledge instructions concerning reinitiating our work on the SILVA THINS modification. We are considering this project high priority and plan to have samples for evaluation at the earliest possible date. We are also reviewing our previous work on Virginia Slims non-menthol and will initiate whatever work necessary to aid us in the project.
To
CONFIDENTIAL
FROM :selected:

paragraphs.content: R. M. Irby, Jr., Manager - New Products Division Rassarch and Development
Production scheduled in the factories for the week beginning November 17 includes 15 million SILVA THINS Menthol "S" and 10 million SILVA THINS Menthol "E" Cigarettes.

We have prepared a blend which we believe will be more in line with our require- mente with regards to taste and palstability of the smoke. Cigarettes will be fabricated on Tuesday, November 18, for full evaluation. We have contacted the Leaf Department concerning the availability of light (mountain type) Burley tobacco which we feel would be desirable for use in this cigarette. We are experimenting with TAREYTON type filters as well as all cellulose acetate filters in an attempt to assure that the taste of the cigarette is smooth and satisfying.

We are currently evaluating cigarettes made from various RC sheets prepared from types of tobacco in order to establish firm guidelines for the most satisfactory formula for the blended sheet. Our current feelings are that more leafy grades of tobaccos might be necessary since some of the desirable characteristics may be lost in the fabrication process.

Our Initial, samples of SILVA THINS were not satisfactory with regard to the required percentages of RC-FS and Durham is remaking these samples. As soon as we complete our evaluation, we will forward them to New York for your consideration. LUCKY STRIKE and PALL MALL Cigarettes containing the new RC formula will be fabricated at Virginia Branch during the latter part of next week.

We acknowledge instructions concerning reinitiating our work on the SILVA THINS modification. We are considering this project high priority and plan to have samples for evaluation at the earliest possible date. We are also reviewing our previous work on Virginia Slims non-menthol and will initiate whatever work necessary to aid us in the project.
